name: 9.12 "Norm and Cliff's Excellent Adventure" Online Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who let everyone into the bar at the opening of the show?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	Everyone was standing outside freezing because no one (who worked at Cheers) had a key. Norm came a long and apologized for being late and let everyone in.

questions.text: Who was late getting to Cheers?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam wondered why no one had unlocked the door yet and gone in. They told him they didn't have their keys. He said that he was counting on theirs. That is when Norm came.

questions.text: Who got hooked on the home shopping channel?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Woody had never seen the home shopping channel before. When he did he was hooked instantly. He couldn't believe all the stuff he could buy.

questions.text: What did the cow clock say?
questions.explanation:
It's moooon.

	It said, "It's moooon" no matter what time it was. Woody told Rebecca that a cows use of language was limited so everything sounded like, "It's moooon."

questions.text: Who called the credit card company and reported Frasier's credit card stolen?
questions.explanation:
Norm and Cliff.

	Sam had to cut up Frasier's credit card. He said if he didn't they'd take away "his credit card thingy".

questions.text: Who was fighting in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Sam and Frasier.

	Frasier didn't think Sam would actually cut up his credit card. When he did Frasier became furious and wanted nothing more to do with Sam or the bar.

questions.text: What did Rebecca say people would think if she kept accepting gifts from Woody?
options: That Woody had a crush on her.
questions.explanation:
That she liked crap.

	Woody said "Are you calling this stuff crap?" Rebecca apologized to him and he said, "No, I've been looking for the right word for this...crap." Rebecca asked him why he kept buying stuff if he didn't like it and Woody told her he was hooked. He said it looked so good on TV but then when he got it, it wasn't.

questions.text: Who said she couldn't sympathize with Frasier anymore?
questions.explanation:
Lilith.

	Frasier had been whining and complaining for days about Sam cutting up his credit card. Lilith got tired of listening to it.

questions.text: What song did Frasier serenade Lilith with?
questions.explanation:
Autumn in New York.

	Halfway through the song Frasier broke down crying saying that he bought the piano with his gold card.  Autumn in New York was written by Vernon Duke in 1934.Here are the lyrics: "Autumn in New YorkWhy does it seem so inviting?Autumn in New YorkIt spells the thrill of first-nightingGlittering crowds and shimmering clouds in canyons of steelThey're making me feel I'm homeIt's autumn in New YorkThat brings the promise of new loveAutumn in New YorkIs often mingled with painDreamers with empty handsThey sigh for exotic landsIt's autumn in New York"It's good to live it againLovers that bless the darkOn benches in Central ParkIt's autumn in New YorkIt's good to live it again

questions.text: Whose credit cards were given to Woody at the end of the show?
questions.explanation:
Norm and Cliff's.

	Sam found out what the two did and to teach them a lesson he gave Woody the credit cards to continue shopping on the Home Shopping Channel. Norm and Cliff begged him to cut their cards up instead.
